question_sentence: Ukraine's "Operation Spider's Web" assault on multiple Russian airbases involved how many drones?
evidence: Ukraine's coordinated strikes on four Russian airbases – believed to have inflicted billions of dollars' worth of damage – took 18 months to plan, and involved smuggling the drones to staging sites deep inside Russian territory. Vladimir Putin has vowed to take revenge for the attack, and for a separate Ukrainian strike on a road and rail bridge in occupied Crimea.

question_sentence: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth has announced plans to rename a navy vessel named after which figure?
evidence: Hegseth has ordered the US navy to rename the USNS Harvey Milk, removing the name of the pioneering gay rights activist, who was also a Korean War navy veteran. An internal memo defended the change as a move to align with Donald Trump's objectives to "reestablish the warrior culture".

question_sentence: Who will be South Korea's next president after winning Tuesday's election?
evidence: Lee, who represents the centre-left Democratic Party, saw off right-wing challenger Kim Moon-soo in an election that took place exactly seven months after former president Yoon Suk Yeol attempted to declare martial law and was subsequently impeached. A little more than 79% of eligible voters cast their ballot – the highest turnout in almost 20 years.

question_sentence: Which country has apparently surpassed Australia to become the world's sweariest nation?
evidence: The US has overtaken Australia as the world's sweariest nation, according to a University of Queensland study. After analysing 1.7 billion words of online content from 20 English-speaking countries, researchers found Americans use profanity most frequently online, followed by the UK and Australia.

question_sentence: Which online platform has gone up for sale at a reported price of $8 billion?
evidence: The platform for X-rated content creators generated revenues of $6.6 billion (£4.8 billion) in the year to November 2023. But despite its eye-watering profits, investors remain wary of the reputational risk of being associated with the brand – not just for its raunchy content, but for damaging stories linking the platform to exploitation and inadequate age verification.

question_sentence: Donald Trump reinstated a blanket ban on citizens of how many countries entering the US?
evidence: Donald Trump revived his first-term travel ban targeting mostly African and Middle Eastern countries, plus three in the Americas. He has also blocked nearly all foreign students from entering the US to attend Harvard. He "justified" the ban by citing high visa overstay rates, "deficient" screening standards and a recent attack on a Jewish group unrelated to the affected nations.

question_sentence: The government of which EU country has collapsed after the far-right withdrew its support from the coalition?
evidence: Geert Wilders pulled his Freedom Party out of the ruling coalition that has governed the country for the last 11 months, accusing his coalition partners of obstructing the party's hard-right agenda on immigration. Prime Minister Dick Schoof is to remain on a caretaker basis until a new election is held.

question_sentence: New research has found that women who drink what beverage age more healthily?
evidence: A Harvard study that tracked nearly 50,000 women over 32 years found that those who drank caffeinated coffee were significantly more likely to maintain physical, mental and cognitive wellbeing into their 70s and older. No similar benefits were found for tea or decaffeinated coffee.

question_sentence: A man has been arrested for damaging which legendary historical attraction?
evidence: A 30-year-old man vaulted over a railing to access the enclosure where thousands of terracotta warriors "guard" the vast mausoleum of Qin Shi Huang, the first emperor of China. The unidentified intruder, who was reportedly suffering from mental health issues, then proceeded to jostle and push the priceless statues, which are more than 1,000 years old.

question_sentence: Which Italian volcano erupted on Monday?
evidence: One of the world's most active volcanoes, Etna erupted in plumes of smoke and outpourings of lava on Monday. Warnings had been issued well in advance; nobody was injured and planes continued to land and depart from nearby Catania airport.

question_sentence: Which reason did President Donald Trump cite when he signed a proclamation this week banning travel from 12 countries to the US?
choices: They raised tariffs on US imports
National security and public safety threats
They supply nuclear materials to North Korea
evidence: Trump cited the need to protect the US from "foreign terrorists and other national security and public safety threats” when banning the 12 countries.

question_sentence: A man recently attacked a group of people calling for the release of Israeli hostages in Gaza with incendiary devices and a makeshift flamethrower. Where did the incident take place?
evidence: The man allegedly yelled “Free Palestine!” during the antisemitic attack in Boulder, Colorado. He now faces federal hate crime charges.

question_sentence: The acting head of which government agency told staffers this week that he was unaware the US has a hurricane season?
evidence: While some FEMA personnel interpreted the remark as a joke, others said it raised concerns about acting head David Richardson's ability to lead the agency during such a critical time. Hurricane season began on June 1.

question_sentence: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has ordered the Navy to rename which ship?
evidence: Hegseth ordered the secretary of the Navy to rename the oiler ship USNS Harvey Milk. A Navy veteran and gay rights activist, Milk was assassinated in 1978 while serving on the San Francisco Board of Supervisors.

question_sentence: The Department of Justice recently dropped criminal charges against which company?
evidence: The DOJ dropped its criminal case against Boeing despite the company agreeing to plead guilty last year to its role in two fatal 737 Max crashes that killed 346 people.

question_sentence: Senators, governors and other well-known figures have received text messages and phone calls from an impersonator claiming to be which key member of President Trump’s inner circle?
choices: White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles
evidence: Susie Wiles is one of President Trump’s closest advisers and the first woman to hold the title of chief of staff. A senior White House official said that Wiles told others in the Trump administration that she believed her personal phone and contact list had been hacked.

question_sentence: Which NBA team fired its head coach this week?
evidence: The New York Knicks fired head coach Tom Thibodeau just days after the team was eliminated from the playoffs by the Indiana Pacers.

question_sentence: What popular item is returning to the McDonald’s menu?
evidence: The Snack Wrap (chicken, lettuce and shredded cheese wrapped in a tortilla) will return to McDonald’s menus on July 10. But the fast-food chain really should bring back fried apple pies — the baked ones don’t measure up.

question_sentence: A truck overturned last week in Washington state, allowing which of the following to escape?
evidence: A truck hauling an estimated 70,000 pounds of hives rolled over close to the Canadian border, allowing the honeybees to escape. Local beekeepers helped to recover and reset the hives.

question_sentence: A group of actors from “Back to the Future” issued a plea to fans and collectors to help find which missing piece of movie memorabilia?
evidence: Michael J. Fox played the now-missing Gibson ES-345 guitar in the pivotal "Enchantment Under the Sea" scene.
